title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Computer Network Architect

content.rendered:
What is a Computer Network Architect?

Computer Network Architects are the planners and designers of internal computer networks. Projects could range from all kinds of data communications–depending on what the company needs.

Where does a Computer Network Architect work?

  • Computer system design companies
  • Insurance carriers
  • Telecommunications

How much does a Computer Network Architect make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a computer network architect is $70,225.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Computer Network Architects?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing Computer Network Architect jobs.

  • Computer science majors
  • Software engineering majors
Explore Computer Network Architect job opportunities on Handshake.

Computer Network Architects skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Computer Network Architects succeed in their work:

  • Ability to predict problems and solve them quickly
  • Knowledge of programming languages
  • Strong creative skills

What are some common questions about Computer Network Architects?

Q: What skills will help me succeed as a Computer Network Architect/Engineer?

A: A strong technical foundation is a great way to start building success in this career. You’ll be at an advantage if you’re familiar with coding and circuits.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming a Computer Network Architect.
